cuepoints.caption: Now let's talk about maintaining your equipment.
It's a good idea to keep a soft, lint-free cloth on hand for cleaning.
You should also have some cleaning solution that is ammonia and vinegar-free.
91 percent isopropyl alcohol wipes are useful.
You can pick these up at any drug store.
Before cleaning your Terminal, you must touch the Lock button to avoid placing wagers by accident.
The cleaning process for the Touch Screen, Barcode Scanner, Play Slip Reader, and Ticket Checker is the same.
Use either the alcohol wipes or the cleaning solution and a soft, lint-free cloth.
Lightly spray the cloth
and gently wipe down the equipment.
Never spray cleaning solution directly onto any of the equipment.
For the Play Slip Reader pay close attention to the white strip located behind the Touch Screen.
This is the area that reads the Play Slips and should be kept free of dust and debris.
Now when it comes to the Printer, it is recommended to use the alcohol wipes.
Due to the high gloss on the paper, residue can be left behind on the Print Head.
Over time, this residue could affect the print quality, possibly causing issues such as streaks on the tickets.
The Print Head is located inside the front of the Printer below the two white rollers.
From time to time, make sure you wipe down both the Print Head and the paper path with an alcohol wipe.
If you have questions about cleaning your lottery equipment, ask your lottery representative.
That's all there is to it.
Another maintenance activity you'll be doing on a regular basis is changing the paper in the Printer.
The terminal will display PAPER LOW when the Printer detects the paper is getting low.
You should change the paper as soon as possible after the message appears.
If the message is ignored, the Printer will function until it no longer detects enough paper.
A PAPER OUT message will display which prevents any further functions from being performed until a new roll is loaded.
OK.  So how do you change your paper roll and run a Printer Test?
First, press the silver button on the Printer Cover
and pull up on the sides of the Printer Cover to open.
Next, remove the used paper roll.
Detach the piece of tape on the new roll that holds the end of the paper to the roll
then place the new roll into the Printer.  It is important that the paper feeds from the bottom toward you.
Make sure the paper comes over the roller.
Because this is a new roll, leave about 12 to 18 inches hanging out
and close the cover firmly.
The Printer automatically advances and cuts the paper.
At the bottom of the piece of paper that just dispensed, you should see the words Accutherm-Ultra and other information.
If you do not see this message, the paper is not loaded correctly.
Now run the Printer Test to ensure print quality.
From the Home Screen, touch Services,
then Printer Test.
A receipt displaying every character is printed.
You should run a Printer Test each time you change your paper roll and after clearing a jam.
